column4: I used wubi installer to install ubuntu in my C drive. That drive is running out of memory. How should
How should i increase disk space
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/WubiGuide and scroll down to "How do i resize the virtual disks"
i downloaded an installer but it open in editor
i have a drive in /media so what argument i put in ---> sudo sh wubi-add-virtual-disk /home 15000 <---  also how much GB should i reserve atleast, i.e how much in MB?
I can't understand your half sentences....can you please type full sentences?
i have a drive mounted on the /media directory so what i put in argument for the path?
yes, that is the command assuming you want to resize it to ~15 GB
in the path do i put /home/media/drivename ?
how will it know the particular disk?
because it is currently running off of it
but it is D: i want to move to from C: ?
i am telling in terms of windows
Ok, what is your objective?  to increase the size of the wubi virtual disk?

if i want it to dspread it to another hdd?
